events.message: The customer reported a car accident involving their vehicle rear-ending another car on the highway.
Based on the claim details, the incident was categorized under auto accident coverage as it involved vehicle collision.
An insurance agent was assigned to the claim to guide the customer through the next steps and gather required information.
The claim was officially acknowledged and the customer received confirmation along with information about the process timeline.
The claims department requested photos of the damaged vehicle, police report, and repair estimate to proceed with the investigation.
The customer submitted all requested documents including detailed photos, official police report, and the mechanic’s damage assessment.
The investigation team began reviewing all submitted evidence and contacted the repair shop for additional information.
Investigation concluded that the vehicle damages align with the reported collision and liability is assigned to the other driver.
A settlement offer was made to cover the repair costs and rental car reimbursement based on the investigation findings.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the prompt communication and fair settlement proposal after review.
The claim was formally approved for payment and the finance department was notified to issue funds promptly.
Payment was issued to the customer’s designated account covering the full approved settlement amount as agreed.
The claim file was closed following successful payment issuance and confirmation of customer satisfaction.
All claim documents were archived securely for record-keeping and future reference as required by policy.
